column4: I've got a divided rar archive, and when I try to unrar it I get the following error message: "Archivetype is not supported", do I need another unpacking program to unpack it?
try unrar from rarlabs... then issue this command: unrar e ~myuser/path_to_rar.rarX (take the first in the part-serie)
type wget http://www.rarlab.com/rar/rarlinux-3.6.0.tar.gz or surf there. then download it, and tar zxvf file.tar.gz then run "unrar" program with ./unrar e file.rarX (first of the partfiles)
have you extract the files from the arhive?
yes. ok enter that folder then type ./unrar and see what happends.. if it's starting at all..
yup that program is a console-application
if you want to extract the files to an other place then the directory you are in issue this command: ./unrar x path_to_file.rar00 /path/to/where/to/extract
or do like this: sudo cp /path/to/rar/unrar /usr/local/bin and also the same command but for "rar"
it will extend your PATH so that it will include the unrar and rar program when typing it in the console
well then you have to have the program in your homedirectory and put it chmod -R 700 rarfolder/ then use the export command..
you wont need that if you have VLC :)
have you tried it with MPlayer ?
did you have mplayer at all?
cheers enjoy your movie :) (it's night time in sweden)
